summary: The text describes a sequence of groups that have fallen into ruin or destruction. It outlines how different people throughout history, including those before the Law was given, idol worshippers after the Deluge, false prophets, and the Jews who killed the Lord and persecuted the apostles, all faced destruction. Additionally, it discusses the persecution of the Church by pagans at the time of John's vision. The passage mentions that five heads of the beast, which represent both mountains and kings, have already fallen, symbolizing the punitive fate of previous sinners and impious Jews.
